case_description: A journalist published an investigative article alleging corruption in procurement by a public official. The official filed a criminal defamation case under Section 499 IPC. The journalist claims protection under Article 19(1)(a) of the Constitution and argues that the publication was in public interest.
legal_question: How is balance maintained between the right to free speech and criminal defamation under Indian law, and what defences are available to journalists under Section 499 IPC?
